item.title: Get started with Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs) in Uberflip
item.description:
Learn all about Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs): what they are, how they work, and how you can use them in Uberflip.

 

What are Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs)?

As with Marketing Streams in your Hub, a DSR is a collection of your content items, presented as an attractive content experience. But unlike Streams, which are typically intended for fairly wide audiences, Sales Streams are hyper-focused: they are created and personalized for a very specific audience, in many cases just a single person.

As the name suggests, DSRs are primarily intended to be used by your sales team. By giving them access to your content library, along with a fast and convenient way to share that content with their leads and prospects, DSRs enable your sales team to sell more effectively by fostering conversations at all stages of the buyer journey.

 

How do DSRs work?

Creation

You can create DSRs just like a Stream, from the Content section of the Uberflip app.  You can also copy a Marketing Stream as the base for a new DSR.

Tip

The best way to create DSRs and do sales engagement is with Sales Assist. Check out the Sales Assist guides to learn more.

To create and share DSRs in Uberflip, your users must have their own user account within your Uberflip account, and must be assigned to the Sales Reps user group (or otherwise be manually given the relevant permissions). You can assign as many users to the Sales Reps user group as you have purchased Sales seats (licenses). In addition, Admins and Content Managers can also create DSRs.

Creating a DSR does not count towards your number of Marketing Streams, and your Sales Reps can create unlimited Sales Streams.

Note

Existing DSRs can only be viewed by the Sales Rep who created them, and the Primary User on the Uberflip account. When viewing a list of Streams, any type of user except the Primary User will only see DSRs that they have created themselves (if any).

For detailed instructions on creating and using DSRs, see below.

Appearance

Like Marketing Streams, DSRs consist of a homepage with a title, an optional description, and at least one Item tile.

You can also go beyond this default appearance, and further personalize a DSR by enhancing it with a customizable banner (and even the prospect organization's logo).

Behavior

Because DSRs are designed to privately share content with a small audience of known individuals, they are:

  • Hidden: Sales Streams are only accessible through a direct link, and can't be found or viewed by regular visitors to your Hub
  • Isolated from your main Hub: Items within Sales Streams do not link to their original Source Streams

As a result, clicking on any Item within a DSR will open the content on a new page which is still within the DSR, and there are no links out to the larger Hub (only to other content Items within the same DSR). This ensures that your target leads/prospects with whom you share the DSR are kept within the experience that you have specifically curated for them.

 

Next steps

Ready to create a DSR? Check out: Create and share a DSR

item.title: Create and share a Digital Sales Room (DSR)
item.description:
Learn how you can leverage content in your conversations with leads and prospects by creating personalized content experiences with Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs).

 

Before you begin

  • To work with DSRs, you must be a member of the Sales Reps, Account Administrators, or Content Managers user groups.

 

About DSRs

Your marketing team creates a ton of content which is designed to generate leads, and to advance prospects through your funnel. Instead of just throwing all of that content onto the internet and hoping someone consumes it, they use Uberflip to create content experiences. This basically means presenting relevant content in a way that is attractive, structured, and engaging.

As a salesperson, you can use DSRs to create your own content experiences in Uberflip. This allows you to share content with your prospects in a compelling way, helping to drive conversations with them. A DSR is essentially a self-contained "mini content experience" — a personalized collection of relevant content created just for a specific prospect

Once created, your new DSR will only be accessible from a specific (and customizable) URL that you can share with your prospect.

 

Create a new DSR

Tip

The best way to create DSRs and do sales engagement is with Sales Assist. Check out the Sales Assist guides to learn more.

Creating a DSR in Uberflip is easy, and only takes a few minutes. There are two ways you can create a DSR:

  • From scratch: Create a brand new DSR from the ground up using the Uberflip web app.
  • By copying an existing Stream/DSR: Copy an existing Marketing Stream or DSR to form the basis of your new DSR, then customize and personalize it.
From scratch By copying an existing Stream/DSR

Follow these steps to create a brand new DSR, where you choose each piece of content to be included yourself.

  1. Log in to Uberflip at https://app.uberflip.com
  2. After you log in, you should be on the Content page in Uberflip, where you can see all the content that you have access to
  3. Click New Stream (in the Streams tab)
  4. The Add a Stream modal will open
  5. Click Digital sales room in the Curated Streams list
  6. Fill out the DSR form that opens, which includes: 
    • Internal Stream Name (optional)
      A name for your DSR that won't be shown publicly. It's just for you and your team.
    • Stream Page Title (required)
      A title for your DSR that will appear at the top of the DSR page. This will be seen by your prospect.
    • Stream Page Description (optional)
      A brief description of the DSR for your prospect. You can use this field to personalize your DSR and include a brief message to your prospect.
    • Stream Purpose (required)
      Choose a purpose for this DSR. This won't be shown to your prospect.
  7. When done, click Create
  8. Your DSR is now created, and you'll be taken to its Stream menu where you can add content Items to it. To begin, click Add Items 
  9. The Add Items to Sales Stream modal will open, where you can choose which Items you want to include. Items from all Streams in your Hub(s) will be shown, and you can narrow this down by using the dropdown menus and search box along the top:
  10. To add any Item to your DSR, click on it. A checkmark will appear in the top right corner of selected Items to indicate they will be added to the DSR. To remove any previously selected Item, just click on it again to remove the checkmark.
  11. You can see the number of Items currently selected in the lower right. Click Add to add them to the DSR
  12. You'll be returned to the Stream view, where the content Items you added will now be shown. Content will be displayed in your DSR in the order shown here. To reorder Items, simply drag-and-drop their tiles into the desired order.
  13. To preview your DSR, click Open in the toolbar
  14. Your DSR will open in a new tab, and you can see what it'll look like to your prospect

Now that everything is set up, you're ready to share your DSR!

Follow these steps to create a new DSR by copying an existing Stream or DSR.

When you do this, your new DSR will be pre-populated with the content from the Stream or DSR you copied: from there, you can simply add or remove content to customize the DSR for your prospect. This is especially useful if you find yourself sharing the same pieces of (usually high-value) content with most of your prospects, for example.

Tip

To really save time, create a Stream that contains just the content Items you share the most. You can then create all your new DSRs by simply copying this "template Stream" every time.

  1. Log in to Uberflip at https://app.uberflip.com
  2. After you log in, you should be on the Content page in Uberflip, where you can see all the content that you have access to
  3. In Streams tab, find the Marketing Stream or DSR you want to duplicate and click it to open it
  4. In the Stream editor, click the three-dot "meatball" menu
  5. In the menu that opens, click Copy to Another Sales Stream (on a Sales Stream) or Copy to a Sales Stream (on a Marketing Stream)
  6. This will open the Copy to a Sales Stream modal. Fill out the form, which includes:
    • Internal Stream Name (optional)
      A name for your DSR that won't be shown publicly. It's just for you and your team.
    • Stream Page Title (required)
      A title for your DSR that will appear at the top of the Stream page. This will be seen by your prospect.
    • Stream Page Description (optional)
      A brief description of the DSR for your prospect. You can use this field to personalize your Stream and include a brief message to your prospect.
    • Pick a hub for this Sales Stream (If you have multiple Hubs in your account)
      Use this to choose the Hub in you want to create the copied DSR in. By default, the same Hub you're copying from will be pre-selected.
  7. When you're done, click Copy

Your DSR will be created, with all of the Items from the original Stream/DSR already included. From here, just add or move Items and customize the Stream as needed, then you're ready to share your new DSR.

Note

While copying a Stream will bring over all the content Items from the original Stream, none of the other Stream or appearance options will be copied, so you would need to recreate these on the resulting DSR.

 

Share a DSR

When your DSR is set up and ready, all that's left to do is share it with your intended prospect. There are two ways to share it, with the URL and with the built-in sharing options:

Direct (URL) Sharing Options

Follow these steps to simply share the direct URL for the DSR, for example in an email. You can also customize this URL if you want (see this article). 

  1. Head to the Content page in Uberflip (Content > Streams tab) and click on the Sales Stream you want to share
  2. In the Stream editor, click Open in the toolbar
  3. While viewing the DSR in your browser, simply copy the URL from the address bar

  4. You can now paste the URL anywhere you want to share it (like an email), and anyone with the URL can view the DSR.

Follow these steps to share your DSR directly to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, by email, or using HootSuite with the built-in sharing tool.

  1. Head to the Content page in Uberflip (Content > Streams tab) and click on the Sales Stream you want to share
  2. In the Stream editor, click the three-dot "meatball" menu, then click Share 

  3. In the Share this Stream menu that opens, click the option you want to use to share the DSR

  4. Depending on your choice, the corresponding app will open, where you can then share the DSR

 

Next Steps

Now that you know how to create and share DSRs, learn how you can further enhance those content experiences by customizing their look and feel, and how you can work with your existing DSRs, in: Customize and Manage Your Sales Streams

item.title: Customize and manage your DSRs
item.description:
Learn how you can customize the look and feel of your Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs), as well as how to manage your existing DSRs.

 

Before you begin

  • To work with DSRs, you must be a member of the Sales Reps, Account Administrators, or Content Managers user groups.

Note: Who can manage DSRs?

DSRs are only visible to the user who created them, so all users can only manage their own DSRs (including Account Administrators).

The only exception is the Primary User on the Uberflip account, who can see all DSRs created within the account by any user.

 

Customize a DSR

You can customize the look and feel or your DSRs in various ways to further personalize them for your intended audience. You can change the DSR's URL Path, customize different Stream Options, and modify the appearance of the DSR:

URL Path DSR Options DSR Appearance

You can customize the last portion of the DSR's URL, after the slash (the URL path):

By default, the URL path is set to the name that you chose when you created the DSR, but you can change it to anything you like. To do that, open the DSR in the Uberflip app (Content > Streams tab > click on the DSR), then click on the Metadata tab. Here, type the URL path that you want to use instead into the URL Path field:

Your change will be saved automatically, and will take effect immediately. Any previous URL paths for the DSR will be shown underneath the URL Path field:

Any URL path shown here will remain active, and can be used to access this DSR. To remove a previous URL path, click on the x button to its right. Removing a URL path will mean that the DSR can no longer be accessed using that URL.

Your DSR has a number of different options that you can enable or disable. You can find these under the Options tab in the Stream editor:

Each option's effect is described on that tab, and every option can be immediately turned on or off using its toggle switch on the right side.

You can go beyond the basic design of your DSR and customize its appearance in various ways, including adding a banner, personalizing it with your prospect's logo, etc. For full details on how to do this, see this article.

 

Modify content in an existing DSR

You can work on your existing DSRs at any time to add, remove, or rearrange content Items. To modify a DSR, open it in the Uberflip app (Content > Streams tab > click on the DSR).

While viewing the DSR, you can rearrange the Item Tiles that represent each piece of content by simply dragging-and-dropping them into the desired order.

To add or remove content Items in the DSR, click on the Manage Items button in the top left:

The Update Sales Stream window will appear, where your currently selected Items will be indicated with checkmarks:

  • To add new content to the DSR, click on an Item Tile to select it (selected Items are indicated with checkmarks)
  • To remove a piece of content from the DSR, click on the Item Tile of a previously selected Item (the checkmark will be removed)

To save your changes and return to the Stream view, click Update.

 

Archive a DSR

As you create DSR, your list of DSRs will grow. But if you no longer need a DSR and want to declutter your list, you can archive it.

To archive a DSR, open it in the Uberflip app (Content > Streams tab > click on the Sales Stream), then click on the three-dot "meatball" menu in the top right. In the menu that appears, click on Archive Stream:

If you accidentally archived a DSR, or discover later that you still need it, you can recover archived DSRs.
